definition: to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker
plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: Berths convert to seats for daytime use.
A soldier lies flat on his bunk.
sentences.chinese: 一位土兵仰面躺在铺位上。

sentences.english: The unit size is one hundred and twenty square feet. The net size is one hundred and twenty square feet.
sentences.chinese: 这个铺位的建筑面积约一百二十平方英尺。

sentences.english: The net size is one hundred and twenty square feet.
sentences.chinese: 使用面积约八十平方英尺，这个铺位还没租出。

sentences.english: As he sat on his bunk that final night, butterflies fluttered in his stomach.
sentences.chinese: 在最后一夜他坐在自己的铺位上，开始胡思乱想。

sentences.english: Goldring booked a berth on the first boat he could.
sentences.chinese: 戈德林订了他能订到的最早一班船的铺位。

sentences.english: The other boys had already chosen their bunks when Ender arrived.
sentences.chinese: 安德到的时候其他的孩子已经选好铺位。

sentences.english: When I climbed into my bunk at midnight, dark thoughts joined me.
sentences.chinese: 半夜里，我爬上了自己的铺位，脑子里愁云密布。

sentences.english: Getting to that top bunk demanded agility; it was reached by a very vertical, very narrow ladder.
sentences.chinese: 爬到上面铺位需要身手敏捷，有一架狭窄的垂直梯子。

sentences.english: Out here with me, bunking up.
sentences.chinese: 在这和我一起，轮船铺位。

sentences.english: The unit size is one hundred and twenty square feet.
sentences.chinese: 这个铺位的建筑面积约一百二十平方英尺。
这名乘客的铺位在我的旁边。

sentences.english: The vegetables are purple on the outside and orange in the inside.
sentences.chinese: 他穿着橘红色的囚衣，躺在犯人的铺位上。

definition: soft seat (= first class in PRC trains)
box (in a theater or concert hall)/private room (in a restaurant or karaoke)
by the window (referring to seats on a plane etc)
